SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.mime.headers

Class ChaosHeaders

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.mime.headers.ChaosHeaders
public class ChaosHeaders extends Object
Chaos headers container for testing exception scenarios.

This class provides access to X-Robin-Chaos headers from parsed emails. The chaos headers feature allows testing of exception scenarios by bypassing normal processing and returning predefined results.

The value format is: ClassName; param1=value1; param2=value2 where ClassName represents the implementation class where the action occurs.

Example usage: 

 ChaosHeaders chaosHeaders = new ChaosHeaders(emailParser);
 List<MimeHeader> ldaHeaders = chaosHeaders.getByValue("DovecotLdaClient");
See Also:
  • EmailParser
  • MimeHeader

  • Method Details

    • getHeaders

      public List<MimeHeader> getHeaders()
      Gets all chaos headers.
      Returns:
      List of MimeHeader instances for chaos headers.

    • getByValue

      public List<MimeHeader> getByValue(String value)
      Gets chaos headers filtered by clean value (class name).

      Note: Matching is case-insensitive for convenience.

      Parameters:
      value - The class name to filter by (e.g., "LocalStorageClient", "DovecotLdaClient").
      Returns:
      List of MimeHeader instances matching the value, or empty list if none found.

    • hasHeaders

      public boolean hasHeaders()
      Checks if chaos headers are present.
      Returns:
      True if at least one chaos header exists, false otherwise.
